title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

To earn this point, the response must include all three critical values: x=1, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C8A@ x=1, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C8A@ and x=3. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C8E@

No supporting work is required, although any presented work must be correct.

The point is not earned if the response presents any extra numbers in the open interval ( −3,   4 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4216@ , or if any critical values are missing.

Disregard presentations of the endpoints or any other numbers outside the open interval ( −3,   4 ). MathType@MTEF@5@5@@42C8@ The point is still earned provided the three critical points x=−1,  MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E9B@ x=1, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C8A@ and x=3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIhacqGH9aqpcaaIZaaaaa@3BDC@ are correctly listed.

If the critical points are given as ordered pairs, e.g., ( −1,   0 ), MathType@MTEF@5@5@@42C0@ ( 1,   0 ), MathType@MTEF@5@5@@41D3@ and ( 3,   0 ), MathType@MTEF@5@5@@41D5@ read the x MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIhaaaa@3A19@ -coordinates, and disregard the y MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadMhaaaa@3A1A@ -coordinates.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

Each critical point from part (a) must be accompanied by a correct justification to earn the point.

A response giving justifications based on h ′ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadIgagaqbaaaa@3A15@ is eligible for all three points.

If a response gives justifications based only on g, MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadEgacaGGSaaaaa@3AB8@ then:

· the response is eligible for all three points, if the response presents the connection between h ′  ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E4B@ and g ( x ), MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EEE@ (that is, h ′ =g MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C26@ ). If you do not see this in part (b), look for it in part (a). If you find this connection in either part, read all subsequent occurrences of g MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadEgaaaa@3A08@ or h ′ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadIgagaqbaaaa@3A15@ as h ′ =g, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CD6@ throughout all parts of this question.

· the response is eligible for at most two of the three points, if the response does not present the connection h ′  ( x )=g ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4473@ . Any additional error (for example, not justifying that at x=−1, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D77@ h MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIgaaaa@3A09@ has a relative minimum) is eligible for at most one of the three points.

Read references to “the graph” as references to g ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E3E@ as indicated by the stem.

A response referencing “the function” or “it” or “the slope” is vague. A response of this type can earn a maximum of one point in this part. This type of response earns that one point if replacing every occurrence of “the function” or “it” or “the slope” with h ′ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadIgagaqbaaaa@3A15@ produces a response that would earn all three points.

A response that discusses h ′ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadIgagaqbaaaa@3A15@ at a particular point (e.g., “ h ′  ( 3 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E0B@ changes from negative to positive”) when the discussion should have been about h ′  ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E4B@ can earn at most two of the three points because of poor communication. A response of this type that otherwise correctly classifies and justifies all three critical points earns two points, otherwise correctly classifying and justifying two critical points earns one point, and otherwise correctly classifying and justifying one critical point earns no points.

A sign chart by itself is not sufficient to earn any points. A sign chart must be accompanied by sufficient written explanation of what it means.

Responses using a Candidates Test are eligible for all three points. h ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E3F@ values for x=−1,   1,   3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4813@ must be included in the table or list of values. The correct values of relevant inputs include:

· h ( −3 )= 3 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@41B9@

· h ( −1 )=− 1 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@42A2@

· h ( 1 )=1− π 4 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4374@

· h ( 3 )= 5 2 − π 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4482@

· h ( 4 )=2− π 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4376@

Special Case: The response presents a communication error in describing the change in sign at the critical points that results in a “global” rather than a “local” argument. These earn two of three points. For example, a response that presents all three of the following statements in part (b) earn two points:

· At x=−1, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D77@ h MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIgaaaa@3A09@ has a relative minimum because h ′ =g MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C26@ is negative for x<−1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CC5@ and h ′ =g MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C26@ is positive for x>−1. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D7B@

· At x=1, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C8A@ h MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIgaaaa@3A09@ has neither because h ′ =g MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C26@ is positive for x<1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIhacqGH8aapcaaIXaaaaa@3BD8@ and h ′ =g MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C26@ is positive for x>1. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C8E@

· At x=3, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C8C@ h MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIgaaaa@3A09@ has a relative maximum because h ′ =g MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C26@ is positive for x<3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIhacqGH8aapcaaIZaaaaa@3BDA@ and h ′ =g MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C26@ is negative for x>3. title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The first point is earned by the correct answer. In addition, responses may give closed, half-open, and open intervals; that is, [ 3,  4 ],  MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4242@ ( 3,  4 ],  MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4242@ [ 3,  4 ), MathType@MTEF@5@5@@40FF@ and ( 3,  4 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4005@ all earn the first point.

In order to be eligible for the second point, the first point must have been earned.

A response referencing only h ′ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadIgagaqbaaaa@3A15@ is eligible to earn the second point.

A response referencing only g MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadEgaaaa@3A08@ is not eligible to earn the second point, unless the response has established the link between g ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E3E@ and h ′  ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E4B@ previously in part (a) or part (b), in which case the response is eligible to earn the second point.

The reason “ h ′ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadIgagaqbaaaa@3A15@ is decreasing” can also be expressed by either “ h ′ ′ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadIgagaqbgaqbaaaa@3A20@ is negative” or “the slope of h ′ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadIgagaqbaaaa@3A15@ is negative.”

A response referencing just “the function” or “it” or “the slope” is vague and does not earn the second point. Note that responses of this type are eligible for a maximum of one point in part (b) and one point in part (c); that is, a response of this type fails to earn points in both parts (b) and (c).

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

Correct supporting work is needed to earn this point.

The correct decimal value is h ( 2 )= 0.429. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4483@ If this decimal value is given, it must be correct, rounded or truncated, to three decimal places.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

A response of − 1 2 +2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D6C@ earns both points. This is the minimal amount of work that earns both points.

As indicated by this minimal answer, the value of an integral (that is, −2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacqGHsislcaaIYaaaaa@3AA5@ or 1 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AE1@ ) does not need to be explicitly linked with an integral to earn the first point.

A response of h ( −3 )= 3 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@41B9@ with no supporting work earns the second point only.

title: Part F
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

A response of h ′ ′  ( −1 )=1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@40C2@ or g ′  ( −1 )=1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@40D5@ or even simply stating a numerical value of 1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaaigdaaaa@39D7@ clearly marked as the answer earns the point.

No supporting work is required because the answer of 1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaaigdaaaa@39D7@ can easily be read from the graph.

title: Part G
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

To earn the first point, responses must indicate that h MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIgaaaa@3A09@ is continuous and differentiable. An ambiguous reference to h MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIgaaaa@3A09@ (e.g., “the function is continuous and differentiable”) does not earn the first point. The interval on which h MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIgaaaa@3A09@ is continuous and differentiable does not need to be stated. If an interval is given, it must be correct with the possible exception of inclusion/exclusion of the endpoints.

To earn the second point, responses must provide both an affirmative response to the question (can be implicit) and indicate that the Mean Value Theorem applies (e.g., either by referencing the Mean Value Theorem or by restating the statement in the stem of the problem). Examples include:

· “Yes, h ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E3F@ is continuous and differentiable so MVT applies” earns both points.

· “Yes, h ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E3F@ is continuous and differentiable, therefore there must be a value where h ′  ( r ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E45@ equals the average rate of change of h ′  ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E4B@ ” earns both points.

· “Yes, h ′  ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E4B@ (the derivative of h ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E3F@ ) is continuous and differentiable, therefore there must be a value where h ′  ( r ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E45@ equals the average rate of change of h ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E3F@ ” does not earn the first point, but does earn the second point.

· “Yes because of MVT” does not earn the first point, but does earn the second point.

· “Yes, because h ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E3F@ is continuous and differentiable” earns the first point, but not the second point.

· “Yes, because h ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E3F@ is continuous” earns neither point.

· “Yes, because h ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E3F@ is differentiable” earns neither point.

· “Yes” earns neither point.

A response of “No” earns neither point, regardless of any other explanation including any reference to MVT.

Special case: a response that claims “ h MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIgaaaa@3A09@ is not differentiable, so therefore the MVT does not apply” earns one of the two points.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part H
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

A response of lim x→2 h ′  ( x ) 5x = 1 10   MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4BF4@ earns the point, as does just stating the answer of 1 10 . MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C4C@

No additional supporting work is required.

The response does not need to state that h ′ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadIgagaqbaaaa@3A15@ is continuous. If the response does state that h ′ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadIgagaqbaaaa@3A15@ is continuous, an explanation is not required.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes the criteria below.

title: Part I
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The first point is earned only for the correct application of the chain rule. If x=−2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CC8@ is substituted for x, MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIhacaGGSaaaaa@3AC9@ then x=−2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CC8@ must appear unsimplified in at least one factor in order to earn the first point. Responses that earn the point include:

· h ′  ( x 2 ) ⋅ 2x MathType@MTEF@5@5@@467A@

· g ( x 2 ) ⋅ 2x MathType@MTEF@5@5@@466D@

· h ′  ( ( −2 ) 2 ) ⋅ 2 ⋅ ( −2 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5086@

· g ( ( −2 ) 2 ) ⋅ 2 ⋅ ( −2 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5079@

· h ′  ( 4 ) ⋅ 2 ⋅ ( −2 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4CE1@

· g ( 4 ) ⋅ 2 ⋅ ( −2 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4CD4@

· h ′  ( ( −2 ) 2 ) ⋅ ( −4 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4A68@

· g ( ( −2 ) 2 ) ⋅ ( − 4 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4BEC@

Responses that do not earn the point include:

· h ′  ( x 2 ) ⋅ 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@457D@

· g ( x 2 ) ⋅ 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4570@

· h ′ ( x ) ⋅ 2x MathType@MTEF@5@5@@43D7@

· g ( x ) ⋅ 2x MathType@MTEF@5@5@@455B@

· h ′  ( 4 ) ⋅ ( − 4 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4854@

· g ( 4 ) ⋅ ( − 4 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4847@

· h ( x 2 ) ⋅ 2x MathType@MTEF@5@5@@466E@

The second point is earned for evidence of attempting to apply the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus as evidenced by linking h ′ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadIgagaqbaaaa@3A15@ and g MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadEgaaaa@3A08@ either directly or indirectly in the presented derivative of k ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E42@ or in k ′  ( −2 ). MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FAC@ For example, the second point is earned by g ( x 2 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F50@ or by g ( ( −2 ) 2 ). MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4256@

The second point may be earned without earning the first point. For example, h ′  ( x 2 ) ⋅ 2=g ( x 2 ) ⋅ 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@52D7@ does not earn the first point because the chain rule is applied incorrectly, but does earn the second point because h ′ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadIgagaqbaaaa@3A15@ and A g MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadEgaaaa@3A08@ are linked.

The second point may be earned by going directly from h ′  ( 4 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E0C@ to −1. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiabgkHiTiaaigdacaGGUaaaaa@3B76@ The function g MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadEgaaaa@3A08@ does not have to be stated explicitly. Responses that earn the first two points include:

· h ′  ( ( −2 ) 2 ) ⋅ 2 ⋅ ( −2 )=−1 ⋅ 2 ⋅ ( −2 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@6209@

· h ′  ( ( −2 ) 2 ) ⋅ ( − 4 )=−1 ⋅ ( − 4 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@58EF@

Recall, if x=−2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CC8@ is substituted for x, MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIhacaGGSaaaaa@3AC9@ then x=−2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CC8@ must appear unsimplified in at least one factor to earn the first point.

The first two points may be earned by a single expression. For example, both g ( x 2 ) ⋅ 2x MathType@MTEF@5@5@@466D@ and g ( ( −2 ) 2 ) ⋅ 2 ⋅ ( −2 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5079@ earn the first two points.

The third point is earned for the correct answer of 4 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaaisdaaaa@39DA@ simplified or unsimplified. Responses that fail to earn both of the first two points are not eligible to earn the third point.

Be careful of parenthesis errors in part (i). Responses of the form h ′   ( x ) 2  ⋅ 2x MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4699@ or ( h ′  ( x ) ) 2  ⋅ 2x MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4841@ are not uncommon. These types of responses fail to earn the first point, are eligible for the second point, and fail to earn the third point.
